alert.note: Alert for Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 8:10PM EDT until July 04 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Windsor County in southern Vermont... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 810 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Quechee, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... White River Junction, Woodstock, Hartland Four Corners, Windsor, Woodstock Village, Quechee, Ascutney, Pomfret, Norwich, Hartland, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Hartford, Sharon, Barnard, Springfield, Reading, Queechee State Park, Brownsville, and North Hartland Dam Recreation Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
